New Records: Andries Gous now leading run-scorer in tournament after making unbeaten 80
Quinton de Kock made a 26-ball half-century
Key Match Events: South Africa beat USA by 18 runs in Super 8s opener in Antigua
USA recovered from 76-5 to need 28 off last two overs but fell short
Quinton de Kock scored 74 from 40 balls
Saurabh Netravalkar was the pick of USA bowlers with 2-21
Rabada was the pick of South Africa's bowlers with 3-18
Harmeet Singh and Andries Gous put on a 91-run partnership from 42 balls
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed satisfaction with the win but noted areas for improvement
USA captain Aaron Jones acknowledged the defeat but praised his team's talent and potential
Quinton de Kock, man of the match, appreciated the easier wicket and acknowledged the pressure from Team USA
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa are unbeaten in five matches in this tournament
The match was played in Antigua under sunny conditions
